reviews.review_msg: Capstone B, you've made it to the end of the degree. At this point the project is set, the documents have become routine, and there isn't really any big changes a professor can make to alter the experience. His involvement and presence is minimal, including some throwaway lectures, overall doesn't do anything notably good or bad.
No Clue on Lectures. Lectures not posted and talk about random stuff. We have to take this class but school should look for someone with engineering degree and not physics.

3 lectures in total for a 3 credit course. No coue why tuition fee is charged for this part of the course. Most absurd remarks about students projects with no inpits at all and grades are a game of roulette
no clue how he grades you

You are so useless Andrew. You should go to BCIT and see how they teach their final projects to students. Show up to the lab JUST FOR ONCE and see how much stress and effort this course costs students before opening your mouth with some stupid question regarding biomedical engineering.
Very Easy Going guy but harsh on marking, its impossible to get an A from him, very smart guy, very funny
Grading criteria is his own choice. Unpredictable.
Good guy. He can be biased while marking but is after all a professor :) Just be mature and if you are serious with your work you shall receive a good grade :)
Interesting prof. For this course, make sure you come up with something that will catch his interest then you will do surprisingly well (ie. fancy gadgets instead of pure software proj)
